## Chapter 1 Letter to Shareholders

Dear shareholders,

COVID-19 variants continue to ravage the world this year, with lockdowns and access control everywhere. This affected services, manufacturing and transportation services and resulted in the poor performance of the global economy. The most recent forecast by the IMF (International Monetary Fund) for the global economic growth is 4.4%, down slightly from the previous forecast of 4.9%. That said, the availability of vaccines and the coverage of vaccinations have effectively eased of the pandemic. The IMF forecasts the growth in developed economies to exceed the pre-COVID level in 2024. We have deployed anti-COVID measures by referring to the past experience in order to deal with the uncertainties and the impact of the pandemic and the supply chain instability. We also continued to communicate stakeholders and effectively mitigated the effect on operations. With all these efforts, our revenue this year grew from last year. We report to our shareholders here with sincerity our 2021 operational achievements and 2022 business outlook.

## 2021 Operating Results

The annual revenue reached NT$21.906 billion, up by 4.4% from the previous year. The annual net income was NT$602 million and the earnings per share was NT$1.17. An internal antiCOVID mechanism has been put in place, due to the pandemic and the supply chain instability through the year. The measures adopted include personnel protection, staff management and staggered shifts. The external communication with customers regarding demand and supply, surveys on the supply chain and transportation coordination effectively mitigated the pandemic impacts. COVID-19 has changed the human mobility and work patterns. Home working drives the shipment of notebook computers, data center servers, storage and networking equipment. By the end of last year, we have been awarded tenders for about 700,000 smart meters and we have delivered nearly 600,000 units to date. We continue to develop smart grid technology and capabilities, in alignment with the policy. We have also made good progress in new energy. The accumulated solar generation installations reached 145MWp in capacity and have generated 91MWh. We continue to work with leading players for the development of motor drivers of electric vehicles and we expect to pass the verification and ship in small quantities this year. We are also collaborating with renowned electric motorbike makers in the power management system for battery swapping stations. In sum, we strive to become a total-solution integrated platform for power services.

AcBel has been recognized for our efforts in corporate governance and corporate social responsibility. We received as a Top 50 Corporate Sustainability Award in the 14 th Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award (TCSA); TCSA Corporate Sustainability Report Award for

Electronic Information Manufacturing Industry -Platinum Award; and the silver award in the first TCSA Taiwan Sustainability Action Award (TSAA) in 2021. Our TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures) report was verified by third parties and rated as a pioneer, the highest level. All these awards and prizes are a testimony of AcBel's dedication to returning to the society and commitment in corporate social responsibility.

## Business Environment and Development Strategies

AcBel upholds the commitment of "We Power the World with Sustainable/Renewable Energy and High Efficiency Power Supply", will take its own research and development efficiency as the core in the future, join the concept of providing positive energy of the earth, and strive to create the maximum value for customers, employees and shareholders. In combination of strong R&D momentum, we step into the application of the areas of clean energy, solar power plant, medical equipment and electric vehicle related power products, with a view to become the innovative leading company of smart green energy in the power industry.

## 2022 Operating Prospect

We are developing our business in three domains: power supply for consumers and industries, new energy, and e-mobility. In the power supply market for consumers and industries, we anticipate continued growth in the  consumer segment driven by applications such as smart homes, notebook computers, e-sports, IoTs (Internet-of-Things) and surveillance systems. The industrial power supply segment will see rapid expansion in the market size and orders from customers due to growth in data centers, artificial intelligence, Big Data analytics driven by gradual maturing of 5G use cases and higher penetration of electric motorcycles and vehicles. The Company's sales of power supply products are expected to be 91,339 thousand units this year. The fuel cell market is seeing increasing awareness in sustainability for the environment and  the  economy.  All  the  countries  in  the  world  are  developing  clean  energy.  Our  key international customers are enjoying higher market shares and gradually completing capacity plans in Taiwan. This underpins our year-over-year growth in power supply products. In addition to power supply products, we are also engaged in the integration and assembly services of power supply systems, to boost gross profits and revenues.

The construction of the new Tamsui plant began in January 2020. The pandemic disrupted the original plan for completion at the end of 2021. Currently, ramp-up is scheduled for the third quarter of 2022 with smart production lines and relevant facilities across the board. This is expected to boost revenues and profits. Once the new plant starts production, an application will be submitted to reconstruct the old plant. Hopefully the revamped capacities will join production up over the next two to three years.

Going forward, we will focus on the technological deepening of 5G communication, on -board

power supply, aerospace power supply, high-end consumer and medical power supply with forward-looking application technologies, demonstrating our strong ambition and constant self- requirements and challenges in technology development.

Wish all shareholders.

Good health and good luck.

AcBel Polytech Inc.

Chairman: Hsu Chieh-Li

President: Hsu Chieh-Li

Chief Accountant: Yeh Jin-Mao

## Chapter 2 Company Profile

Established on July 29, 1981, AcBel has grown into one of the world's leading suppliers of switching power supplies based on the sales business of domestic and international electronic parts from the early stage. Driven by global warming, all countries' response to the trend of energy  conservation  and  carbon  reduction  and  government  policies,  we  take  the  power management technology as our core, actively promote the application of green energy, step into the fields of electricity generation, power generation and power innovation, such as solar power plant, alternative energy, energy storage equipment, smart grid, etc. In line with the trend of the electric and intelligent industry, we have invested in the development of electric vehicles, medical, smart home equipment power supply and other related products, and produce products of high quality and high efficiency, with low-cost energy saving and carbon reduction.

Power supply is an important driving force for all electronic products and equipment. How to safely convert electricity into kinetic energy required by electronic products depends on the operation of a stable power supply. The manufacturing base of AcBel is concentrated in Taiwan, China and the Philippines in Asia. In response to customer orders and industrial changes, we expand production capacity timely, promote precise manufacturing, and use the flexible and perfect production network mode to meet the needs of global brand customers. At the same time, we have set up service stations in the United States, Europe, mainland China, Japan and other places, so as to provide a variety of nearby services close to customer needs. With global R&D headquarters in Taiwan and professional R&D teams in mainland China and the United States, we grasp the market trends and meet customer needs for forward-looking technology research and product development, being ready to provide products with high efficiency and high quality on demand.

## II. Evolution history of the Company

Important events during the most recent year and up to the publication date of the annual report are as follows:

## 2020

-  AcBel invested to set up AcTek Energy Co., Ltd. and AcRay Energy Co., Ltd.
-  AcBel was awarded the "2019 Excellent Quality Award" by Accton Group.

-  AcBel received the "Supplier Award" from Diebold Nixdorf.
-  AcBel won 3 awards in the 13th TCSA Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award.
-  The Company's capital by the end of 2020 was NT$5.17 billion.

## 2021

-  The full election held at AcBel's regular shareholders'  meeting changed one third of directors.  Mr.  Hsu Chieh-Li serves as the chairperson of the new board, an important milestone for the generational handover.
-  AcBel received National Enterprise Environmental Protection Award - Silver Award from the Environmental Protection Administration, Executive Yuan
-  AcBel received a Top 50 Corporate Sustainability Award in the 14 th Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award (TCSA).
-  AcBel received the Electronic Information Manufacturing - Platinum Award in the 14 th Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award (TCSA).
-  AcBel received the 2021 TCSA Taiwan Sustainability Action Award (TSAA) -  Silver Award.
-  AcBel received 'Buying Power - Social Innovation Products and Services Procurement Support Award' by Ministry of Economic Affairs, R.O.C. (Taiwan).
-  AcBel passed the TCFD Performance Assessment Statement - Pioneer Level, the highest level rated by SGS.
-  AcBel received Outstanding Serviceability Award from LENOVO.
-  AcBel  Electronic  (WUHAN)  Co.,  Ltd.  received  the  2020  Best  Service  Award  from Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology Co., Ltd. (HIK VISION).
-  AcBel Electronic (Dong Guan) Co., Ltd. received 2020 Outstanding Supplier Award by Zhejiang Dahua Technology Co., Ltd. (DAHUA).
-  AcBel invested in and established AcTel Power Co., Ltd..
-  As of the publication date of this prospectus, the Company's capitalization was NT$5.17 billion.

## 5. Board diversity and independence:

The Company's current Board of Directors is composed of 11 Directors, including three Independent  Directors.  The  nomination  and  selection  of  the  board  members  shall  be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, adopting the candidate nomination system, in compliance with the Election Procedures of Directors and the Corporate Governance Practice Principles, so as to ensure the diversity and independence of Directors.

## (1) Board diversity

Except for the number of Directors who are concurrently managers of the Company shall not exceed one-third of all Directors, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be determined based on the Company's business operations, operating dynamics, and development needs. The policy should include, without being limited to, the following two general standards:

- A. Basic requirements and values: Gender, age, nationality, and culture.
- B.  Professional knowledge and skills: A professional background (e.g., finance, accounting, operation, investment and M&A, risk management), professional skills, and industry experience.

In accordance with Chapter 3 of the Company's Corporate Governance Practice Principles - Strengthen the functions of the Board of Directors, each board member shall have the necessary knowledge, skill, and experience to perform their duties. In order to achieve the ideal objective of corporate governance, the abilities that must be present in the board as a whole are as follows:

- A. The ability to make judgments about operations.
- B. Accounting and financial analysis ability.
- C. Business management ability.
- D. Crisis management ability.
- E. Knowledge of the industry.
- F. An international market perspective.
- G. Leadership ability.
- H. Decision-making ability.

The current board members of the Company all have relevant experience in the same industry and management ability. However, in order to ensure the sustainable operation of the Company, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be mainly based on expertise and complementarity in each sector, followed by gender and age, and will be focused on the younger age and gender diversity in the future.

- 1. Where the Company has posted after-tax deficits in the parent company only financial reports or individual financial reports within the three most recent fiscal years, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to Individual Directors. This requirement, however, shall not apply if the Company has posted net income after tax in the parent company only financial report or individual financial report for the most recent fiscal year and such net income after tax is sufficient to offset the accumulated deficits: None.
- 2. Where the Company has had an insufficient Director shareholding percentage for 3 consecutive months or longer during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration of individual Directors: None.
- 3. Where the Company has had an average ratio of share pledging by Directors in excess of 50 percent in any 3 months during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to each Director having a ratio of pledged shares in excess of 50 percent for each such month: None.
- 4. If the total amount of remuneration received by all of the Directors in their capacity as Directors of all of the companies listed in the financial reports exceeds 2 percent of the net income after tax, and the remuneration received by any individual Director exceeds NT$15 million, the Company shall disclose the remuneration paid to that individual Director or Supervisor: None.

- 6. If the average annual salary of the full-time non-supervisory employees in the Company is less than NT$500,000 in the most recent fiscal year: None.

The Company's annual audit plan shall be drawn up based on the risk assessment results, including the items to be audited every month, and shall be carried out in practice. ## ■ Rights and interests of employees and care for employees

Under the vision of "happy enterprise", our mission is to create a healthy and safe working environment and a happy and growth and learning space for our employees. We treat and respect every employee fairly, and provide all statutory or even superior employee benefits, including but not limited to work interests,  compensation  and  benefits,  insurance  care,  leave  benefits,  care  for  employees,  health promotion and other measures. In order to achieve the vision of "happy enterprise", the Company operates  according  to  the  flying  geese  theory,  emphasizing  four  aspects  of  "team  cooperation, leadership in turn, encouraging peers and mutual support", and implementing four actions of "warmness, attitude, tolerance and positivity", so as to establish a good corporate culture, motivate and stimulate employees' potential and creativity, and achieve the energy for positive cycles of sustainability.

## ￭ Investor Relations

In order to bridge a two-way smooth communication with investors, the Company has set spokesmen and agent spokesmen specially responsible for dealing with shareholders' opinions and feedbacks and convenes investor conferences and shareholders' meetings in accordance with laws and regulations. The Company has set up an investors section on the Company website, where dedicated units can disclose the Company's current business situation immediately, so as to enable investors to fully understand the Company's business performance and long-term strategic direction. ## ￭ Supplier Relations

Based on business vision, market trend, international initiatives, laws and regulations and international standards such as RBA, SA8000, TCFD 、 SBTi, AEO, ISO system, the Company develops relevant supplier management criteria and audit systems to ensure suppliers achieve the objectives of labor rights protection, focusing on environmental safety quality, being committed to environmental protection, pursuit of excellent quality, providing a safe workplace, compliance with laws and policies, and achieving sustainable operation.

The Company has established a sound supply chain management system. Through the application of the information database platform, and the establishment and evaluation of the management system, the Company manages suppliers with unified standards, to expand the comprehensive effect of the green supply chain, achieve mutual benefit and create shared value. In line with the international response to climate change and the trend for carbon reduction, the Company will emphasize the energy consumption and waste management across the value chain, in order to meet the expectations from stakeholders for our ESG efforts.

In  order  to  ensure  that  suppliers  can  truly  implement  the  Company's  sustainable  development requirements, the Company has improved the sustainable management of the supply chain, with the purchasing, quality assurance and management units as the main responsible windows, through the management measures such as supply chain supplier qualification audit system, social responsibility commitment  signing,  supplier  meetings  and  on-site  audit. -  Risk management policies and procedures

The Company established the Risk Management Procedures on August 15, 2007 and amended it in 2020 as the Risk Management Policies and Procedures in order to achieve the Company's strategic objectives and sustainable operation. The most updated version came into force after the resolution by the Board of Directors on March 10, 2021.

The Company takes the Risk Management Policies and Procedures as the highest guiding principle of the Company's risk management, periodically assesses risks annually, identifies and analyzes risks that the Company may face in advance, and then take advance control measures and continuous monitoring and improvement procedures to minimize the possibility of potential risks and minimize the impact on the Company's objectives.

##  Risk management scope

The Company takes precautionary measures in advance to reduce the losses caused by risks. The responsible  unit  addresses  the  risks  that  may  harm  the  Company's  operation  due  to  the international situation, climate change, the overall economy, legal changes and other factors, such as: strategic risks, financial risks, operational risks, hazard risks or other possible hazards that may affect the daily operation of the Company, conducts risk management according to the identifying, evaluating, processing and monitoring procedures to control the risks arising from the Company's business activities to an acceptable extent, assesses the frequency of risk events and the impact on the Company's operations based on the risk matrix, identifies the risk level and priorities, and formulates formulate corresponding management policies.

## ■ Implementation of customer policies

##  Satisfy reasonable customer requirements:

The Company is a professional design foundry for power supply products, stepping into the field of energy integration services, and solar power generation with its proficient and professional power  supply  technology.  The  Company's  clients  include  world-class  international  brand companies, with the requirement to comply with the laws and regulations, rules of international alliances and codes of conduct for customers, including safeguarding labor & human rights, fair treatment of employees, implementing ethical management, and improving corporate social responsibility norms such as environmental protection, safety and health. The Company's actions have been duly met with customer requirements and relevant audits. To address the requirements from customers regarding climate change, carbon reduction pathways and use of renewables, the Company has been implementing greenhouse gas accounting and verification and environmental projects such as TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures), CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) and SBTi (Science Based Targets initiative).

##  Introduce green cycle:

The Company sets "provide a completely green solution, become the best partner of cutting-edge environmental energy" as its business vision, will be "to become the top two power supplier in the  global  power  supply  industry"  as  its  development  goal.  In  addition  to  designing  and manufacturing stable, high-quality, safe and green power products, the Company will develop towards upstream of the supply chain in the future to create an innovative energy aggregation service business model: electricity generation, power transfer, electricity consumption, electricity storage, aggregation service, etc. By leveraging its power supply technology, the Company has been developing automobile power control systems from starting, charging, shunting, to DCDC conversion for both electric two-wheelers and electric four-wheelers. This diversification aims to boost the Company's total revenues.

The Company will introduce the green cycle (green design → green procurement → green manufacturing process → green packaging → green transportation) fully into the product manufacturing process, produce environmental protection and energy-saving product with the improvement of its own research and development technology, to meet the needs and expectations of customers and consumers for power products with a comprehensive quality approach.

##  Customer satisfaction survey:

Customer satisfaction is the core value of the Company, and we attach importance to the views and opinions of customers. Department of dedicated business, customer service and quality assurance  carry  out  customer  satisfaction  surveys  through  monthly  or  quarterly  customer management meetings and the semi-annual rating on product quality, service quality, delivery quality, price quality, technical capability and overall satisfaction, to understand their recognition or criticism on the Company as a reference for improvement in a timely manner. Its statistical comprehensive survey results have been highly recognized by customers for consecutive years.

## ■ Intellectual Property Management:

In order to establish the competitive advantage of products, enhance the brand image, improve the corporate profits, and avoid the loss caused by infringement, the Company's dedicated department has developed an intellectual property management system aligned with business objectives. The purpose is to connects R&D resources with business expansion needs and to ensure the Company's profitability.

-  Patent-related management and protection measures:

The Company has established a reward system for the patent application, encourages R&D personnel to make creative proposals, and assists and tracks patent output for key R&D projects under the product roadmap for the future. Before each application is submitted, the Company carries out the patent literature retrieval process first to understand the prior technical status, strengthens the technical content and discussion of its own patent application. The Company has set up a patent application review committee to receive suggestions by grading, evaluation and discussion, so as to strengthen the quality of the application proposal again.

The  Company  establishes  the  patent  roadmap,  collects,  monitors  and  analyzes  the  patent application status of other companies in the same industry, classifies the patent roadmap according to the technical content and technical feature, so as to establish a technical matrix roadmap, and identify the part without legal risk as the design reference manual for the R&D personnel, and strengthen the research and development energy. For the right of patent announcement suspected of infringement, the Company will conduct previous case retrieval and review history analysis, build profiles and control, and discuss with the R&D personnel, so as to avoid infringement at the design stage and prevent the Company from suffering losses.

-  Trade secret management and protection measures:

The Company stipulates the confidentiality obligation of company secrets, prohibited disclosure or use of the trade secrets owned by the former employer and other provisions in the employee employment contract. The Company files confidential technical documents in the document control center and manages the rights to download, copy and access documents, which is traceable. Access control is set up in important areas. The non-disclosure agreement (NDA) is required to be signed by all the relevant manufacturers.

-  Trademark management and protection measures:

The Company regularly reviews the market expansion plan with relevant personnel, and actively engages in the operation and product sales of nationally registered company trademark.

-  Copyright management and protection measures:

The Company stores important technical related works such as circuit diagram and organization diagram in the document control center or R&D center, with the implementation of access control and flow tracking, and encrypts internal computer files with the implementation of access control and flow tracking.

Please  refer  to  the  Company's  website/Investors  Section/Corporate  Governance  Section (http://www.acbel.com)  for  information  on  the  implementation  of  intellectual  property management of the Company.

## Notes:

Governance structure for sustainable development:

The Corporate Social Responsibility Committee of the Company is coordinated by the President. The committee  is  divided  into  five  functional  groups  to  be  responsible  for  the  formulation  and implementation of sustainable development strategies, including the promotion of social responsibility policies, systems and related management guidelines, as well as corporate governance. The Company has also set up the Corporate Sustainability Office as the CSR coordinating window to collect information on the sustainable development, climate change and energy conservation & emission reduction trends at home and abroad on a regular basis, such as environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG), corporate social responsibility (CSR) and issues that the stakeholders are concerned about, providing strategic references for the operational management and the Board of Directors. The Company reports to the Board of Directors on the outcome of communicating with stakeholders, sustainability trends and the effectiveness of the specific initiatives and implementation results at least once a year, and discloses the sustainability implementation performance to stakeholders by announcing on the Market Observation Post System (MOPS), the Company's website and Corporate Sustainability Reports in accordance with government regulations. Please refer to the Company's website and Corporate  Sustainability Reports  for  the  related  promotion  performance  of  sustainability (http://www.acbel.com).

<!-- image -->

The functions of the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee are as follows:

-  Chairman of the committee: coordinate the ESG strategies, supervising the implementation of plans and performance evaluation.
-  Board of Directors: responsible for supervising the promotion direction and implementation of ESG.
-  Dedicated member: responsible for coordinating the contact between functional groups and assisting the chairman in the supervision and practice of sustainable development promotion.
-  Corporate  Sustainable  Development  Office:  collection  of  the  latest  domestic  and  overseas information on ESG, climate change, energy efficiency and carbon reduction and the issues pertinent to stakeholders; and disclosure of the information on the Company's relevant actions and responses
-  Each functional group: responsible for the planning of ESG, and submitting them to the meeting for discussion and resolution, and implementation.
-  Global plant: Integrate sustainable solutions into local daily operations according to the resolution requirements of the operation headquarters, and ensure that the objectives are met or even exceeded through a PDCA cycle of Plan, Do, Check and Act.

On the other hand, the Company considers the needs of stakeholders, effectively communicates the positive and negative impacts of climate change on the Company's substantive financial,  and  shows  the  Company's  integrated  governance  performance. ## Environmental protection

The  Company  continues  to  promote  the  concept  of  "green  and  sustainable",  pursues  zero pollution, integrates enterprise resources with its own research and development technology, develops energy-saving products and equipment and implement energy-saving schemes. The Company complies with various international environmental protection regulations, such as EU law, in its product development, design and manufacturing process, regularly check the internal energy use efficiency, invests funds to carry out energy efficiency improvement projects to reduce the burden of the earth environment and energy consumption through diversified measures. In addition, the Company actively develops green energy and green energy systems, crossing the energy integration service market.

## (1) Internal actions of the Company:

The Company and its subsidiaries have passed ISO14001, IECQ080000, ISO50001, UL2799 and other  environmental  safety  and  health-related  international  certification,  achieving  the environmental protection, energy sustainability-oriented operational objectives, such as green design, procurement, manufacturing, transportation and product services, to ensure environmentally  friendly design, use and recycling. As the Company's Gold LEED certified Tamsui plant in Taiwan comes online in 2022, this smart production building can effectively enhance the energy and resource utilization efficiency and achieve the goal in environmental sustainability.

The Company actively participates in environmental protection activities such as Green House Gases inventory plan, GHG self-assessment and reduction activities, and contributes to global environmental protection, actively introduces ISO 14064 greenhouse gas inventory, effectively monitors energy use, and reduces environmental impact through the green cycle mechanism. In addition, according to the Treasure Water Sustainable Goals of the United Nations SDGs, the Company introduced ISO 14046 water footprint inventory, reduce the environmental damage caused by water use through the impact analysis of water footprint, reduce water consumption, and reduce the Company's operating costs.

In line with the requirements of government agencies, we have taken the initiative to set energy conservation targets and organize activities to reduce the consumption of natural resources and environmental impact. There has been no violation of environmental laws or punishment during the most recent year up to the date of publication of the annual report.

The Company provides environmental protection and energy-saving education training and organizes activities for employees, and employees lead their family members to work together to protect the earth and reduce the consumption of natural resources and environmental impact. In 2021, the Company continuously organized environmental education and training sessions, beach adoption and beach cleaning activities, to practice the concept of environmental protection.

## (IX) Implementation State of the Internal Control System

- 1. Internal Control Statement

## AcBel Polytech Inc. Statement on Internal Control System

According to the self-evaluation results of the internal control system by the Company in 2021, we hereby state as follows:

Date: March 11, 2022

- I. The  Company's  Board  of  Directors  and  management  are  responsible  for  establishing, implementing, and maintaining an adequate internal control system, and such a system has been established. The purpose of establishing the internal control system is to reasonably assure the following objectives: (a) The effectiveness and efficiency of business operation (including earnings,  operation  performance  and  the  safeguard  of  company  assets);  (b)  the  reliability, timeliness, transparency of report; and (c) Achieve compliance objectives according to the relevant laws and regulations in order to provide reasonable assurances.
- III. The evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control system design and implementation is made in accordance with the Guidelines for the Establishment of Internal Control Systems by Public Companies (the Guidelines). The Guidelines are made to examine the following five factors during the management and control process: (1) control environment, (2) risk assessment and response, (3) control activities, (4) information and communication, and (5) supervision. Each factor also includes several items. Please refer to the Guidelines for the preceding items.
- II. Due to the innate limitation in designing a faultless internal control system, this system can only assure the reasonableness of the above three objectives has been fairly achieved. In addition, the effectiveness of the internal control system could alter over time due to the change of business environment or situation. Since the Company's internal control system is provided with a selfmonitoring mechanism, the Company will take corrective actions in response to any identified deficiencies.
- IV. The Company has examined the effectiveness of each respected area in the internal control system based on the Guidelines.
- VI. This Statement is a significant part of the Company's annual report and prospectus available to the general public. If any of the disclosed contents above contains false information or omits any material content, the Company will involve legal liability under Article 20, Article 32, Article 171 and Article 174 set forth in the Security and Exchange Act.
- V. V. Based on the findings of such evaluation, the Company believes that, on December 31, 2021, it has maintained, in all material respects, an effective internal control system (including the supervision and management of our subsidiaries), to provide reasonable assurance over our operational effectiveness and efficiency, reliability, timeliness, transparency of reporting, and compliance with applicable laws, regulations and bylaws.
- VII. The Company hereby declares that this statement had been adopted by the Board of Directors on March 11, 2022. Among the 11 attending Directors, no one raised any objection and all consented to the content expressed in this Statement.

## (VI) Company's Dividend Policy and Implementation thereof

- 1. Dividend policy adopted in the Company's Articles of Incorporation

The Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses, capital reserves or statutory surplus reserves payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.

- In accordance with Article 26-1 of the Articles of Incorporation, if there are any earnings after the Company's annual closing of the books, the Company shall first pay all taxes and dues and cover accumulated losses, then appropriate 10% of the earnings as the statutory surplus reserve; provided that this restriction shall not apply if the statutory surplus reserve has reached the paid-in capital of the Company. The Company shall make provision or reversal for special surplus reserve from the remaining earnings as required by law or by the provisions of competent authorities. If there is still a balance, the Board of Directors shall draw up an earnings distribution plan for the balance and the undistributed retained earnings at the beginning of the period, and submit it to the board of shareholders for a resolution on distribution.

The Company is at a stage of steady growth. In consideration of the Company's future capital needs and to meet the needs of shareholders for cash inflows, the annual cash dividend paid shall not be less than 50% of the total cash and stock dividends paid in the current year if there are earnings available for distribution after the Company's annual closing of the books.

- In accordance with the Articles of Incorporation, the Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.
- 2. Dividend distributions proposed at the Shareholders' Meeting

## (I) Scope of Business

## 1. The Company's Major lines of Business

As one of the top ten leading manufacturers of switching power supply in the world, AcBel Polytech Inc. is mainly engaged in the research and development, production and sales of power supply, which accounts for about 90% of the total sales. With professional design and rich manufacturing experience, the Company provides customers with high efficiency and energy-saving products and complete power management solutions.

The products mainly include consumer electronic products, such as DC power supply system of power supply and power supply converter applied in desktop computer (PC), notebook (NB), All in One computer  (AIO),  smartphones  and  smart  home  appliances  used  and  other  key  energy-saving components. In addition, the Company also provides complete power management solutions for industrial servers, Storage and Networking products, and has successfully developed power supply products for medical and home care equipment in the medical equipment industry, such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography and other large medical equipment related power products and general products of home care. Besides, the Company also actively carries out strategic cooperation with international companies in the field of smart green energy and enters relevant markets in advance, such as smart grid, alternative energy and electric vehicle charging devices, including on-board electronics and other peripheral charging equipment power supply.

The Company has accumulated experience from the long-term design, manufacturing and production of power supply devices. In line with the international trend of clean energy and the government's energy development policy, the Company officially put into operation the Taiwan solar power plant (station)  industry  in  2017.  By  the  end  of  2021,  it  has  achieved  (including  the  completion  of construction) a site size of 145MWp approximately and expects to work with the power industry to create synergies. The Company's future business strategy will be based on power supply manufacturing and aimed at innovative electricity service. The Company will gradually transform from the role of power product manufacturing to providing power supply service, including power generation, power transfer, electricity consumption, storage and other innovative electricity converging services, and strive to provide system solutions and power services, laying the foundation for the Company to enter the new blue ocean in the next stage of development.

## 1. The Current Status and Development of the Industry

## (1) Power Supply Industry

The Power Supply is designed to provide stable power supply with appropriate voltage or current for electronic products, and is one of the indispensable functional components. According to the different functions and basic structure of products, it can be divided into two categories: Linear Power Supply (LPS) and Switching Power Supply (SPS).

The advantages to use SPS include providing products with low loss, small volume, lightweight, which is in line with the development trend of light, thin and short terminal products and energysaving and environmental protection, and providing a wider range of external imputable voltages than an LPS, and providing the performance of higher power density/conversion efficiency, all of which contribute to wider application scope. The scope of products includes chargers, rectifiers, converters, inverters and an Uninterrupted Power System (UPS).

At  present,  domestic  SPS  manufacturers  are  facing  low  price  competition  from  Chinese manufacturers in the PC and consumer electronic device charger market. Together with the saturated PC market, manufacturers are facing an environment with severe challenges. In terms of data center application, as affected by the epidemic, the construction layout was restricted this year. However, the market for servers and Networking and Telecom products is still booming due to the development of 5G and the demand for work from home and web-based conferencing due to the epidemic. The transfer of most customer orders to Taiwan under the condition of risks hedging as a result of the trade war between China and the United States, the United States sanctions to ban Huawei and SMIC from the American market and the digitization of energy vehicles have further caused the market panic  and  material  market  shortage.  The  change  of  the  external  environment  stimulates  the traditional electronics industry to be a hot industry. As the Company is located in the technology island Taiwan, an adequate supply chain is available for us to provide complete solutions to various emerging industries. With mature AI, further integration of IoT into a new generation of AIoT applications and the introduction of 5G, in addition to traditional computing center applications, Open Source IT servers and Networking and Telecom equipment will be further applied to 5G infrastructure to meet the needs of Edge Computing. Global data center hardware demand is expected to continue to grow. Under the steady growth of the global server and communication equipment market,  domestic  SPS  manufacturers  have  shifted  their  product  strategies  to  develop  servers, workstations, and power suppliers for Networking and Telecom equipment in recent years. The application of such power supplies has led to a trend towards commodity standardization, resulting in lower barriers to enter the market and fiercer competition than ever before. In the low-end SME market, some Chinese manufacturers also began to develop related products and conduct a low-price competition. However, affected by the intensified trade war between China and the United States, telecoms vendors change to adopt open hardware due to information security factors in the 5G infrastructure equipment market and data center equipment market in Europe and the United States. It is expected that in the future, domestic SPS manufacturers will compete in the open hardware market for telecommunications and surveillance, as well as in the high-end and mid-end market, in addition to the mid-end and low-end standardized product market in the professional application fields such as servers, storage and Networking and Telecom equipment. Furthermore, manufacturers are also investing in product development of the green energy conversion market, which was formerly dominated by European, American and Japanese manufacturers, expecting to find new outlets through the extension of power electronics technology.

The infrastructure of a data center includes servers, switches, storage, routers, and communications power. In particular, the demand for power supply of routers and switches is growing continuously. In terms of high-end and mid-end power supply, while the power supply and power density are increasing, the Power Factor (PF), Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) and conversion efficiency of power supply has become the basic technical indexes of power supply. Meanwhile, new applications such as IT equipment power supply, edge computing server power supply, cabinet-level power supply, integrated HVDC input, 48V DC input/output, PoE and integrated backup batteries applied to 5G infrastructure are the direction of technology development.

With society gradually entering an aging society, the demand for personal home care and various medical equipment used in hospitals has also increased. In addition, the wide application of the cloud

has deepened the integration of medical products with the cloud application. In recent years, domestic medical manufacturers have combined medical products with cloud monitoring, making home care more accessible. Therefore, the application of medical products has gradually expanded from medical institutions to home use, as a result, the medical product market is growing year by year.  If  the  standard  product  can  be  horizontally  constructed,  there  will  be  more  application opportunities in the future.

In addition to medical care, training for fitness has become increasingly popular during recent years. Whilst many gyms closed down during the pandemic and consumers purchased equipment to exercise at home, people will return to outdoors for sports once COVID-19 is behind us. Smart fitness equipment serves as an important bridge between the real world and the metaverse. The industry is expecting a return-to-normal growth curve. Smart fitness equipment empowered with consumer electronics technology provides more functions. The integration with online communities enhances the consumers' willingness to use and stickiness. Going digital and smart also brings business opportunities for power supplies. Microcomputers, tablets and large screens that provide interactive functions and motors that simulate real motion all require extra power to drive.

The variety of agricultural and horticulture machinery, traditionally running on internal combustion engines, is moving towards electrification amid the trend for zero carbon emissions and driverless. The charging infrastructure and the demand for chargers will emerge as a new market.

In terms of personal electronic devices, the emergence of new USB Type-C and USB PD, QC, PPS and  other  universal  external  power  supply/charger  supporting  variable  voltage,  USB  Type-C interface terminals have become a standard in consumer electronic products. With the demand for fast charging and the maturity of new components, the power density of high-end products has exceeded 1W/CC, and the power has also moved up from 10W-20W to 65W or even higher, and the output terminals have also increased from one group to multiple groups. In the smart grid market, the demand for smart meters is increasing due to energy shortages and rising  environmental  awareness.  Teclast  is  also  accelerating  the  deployment  of  smart  meters, including meters, communication solutions and data processing platforms. And the Company has also started to deploy the market of smart meters in Southeast Asia, where the market is growing.

The Company integrates multiple smart solutions, such as energy gateways, renewable energy and energy storage equipment, and digitizes and visualizes all devices to generate various services creating a new business model. ## (2) Solar farm industry

Due to the impact of COVID-19, the global supply chain, end market target capacity and final shipments in the solar industry are highly uncertain. In 2021, all countries in the world proposed netzero carbon emission transformation policies to promote industrial transformation, and 134 countries have pledged to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. It is estimated that the sustainable industry market will drive US$90 trillion in business opportunities within 35 years. The United States intends to increase solar power generation to 40%, and is expected to invest two trillion dollars to "rebuild a better future." Japan published the draft of Strategic Energy Plan, aiming to double the proportion of renewable energy power generation within 10 years, which will make Japan surpass

Taiwan and become the biggest player of offshore wind power generation in Asia, and it's renewable energy market will continue to grow. Meanwhile, the European Union proposed a climate neutrality plan, which will impose a carbon tariff (CBAM) on energy intensive products imported into the EU from 2023. The first stage will focus on high-polluting industries, such as cement, fertilizer, steel, aluminum and electricity, and the second stage may include the electronics industry. .

Energy transformation drives the development of the green energy industry. Energy generation, energy storage, energy conservation and smart system integration have become the four major pillars of Taiwan's future renewable energy development. President Tsai Ing-wen announced that Taiwan will move towards net zero carbon emissions by 2050. The Executive Yuan revised the "Climate Change Response Act", which will implement a carbon pricing system and impose carbon fees in 2023. The National Development Council will propose a net-carbon emission road map for Taiwan, promoting revisions of regulations and policy support from seven major aspects, i.e., wind energy, solar energy, geothermal energy, ocean nergy, hydrogen energy, energy storage and carbon sink. In response to the EU's carbon tariffs and the needs of sustainable development, the private sector has also begun to take action. Formosa Plastics Group, Taiwan Cement, China Steel Corporation and other energy intensive industries have fully configured renewable energy. Big electric furnace manufacturers, such as Fenghsin, Haikwang and Weichih, are actively installing solar photovoltaic equipment.

With the introduction of the High Energy User Clause, the transaction volume of green engergy reached about 600 million kWh in 2021, an increase of more than 11 times over the previous year, among which 80% were from land-based wind power generation. The installed capacity of private power plants that can be put into the market is about 1.4 GW, accounting for 13% of the total capacity, and there is still room for growth. The energy storage industry is also in rapid development. In order to stabilize the power supply, Taipower has increased the target capacity of the energy storage system to 1GW. Many companies, such as Tatung Company, Delta Electronics, Ancillary Power and Aerospace  Industrial  Development  Corporation,  have  invested  in  Taipower's  auxiliary  service market. After the launch of the Taiwan Electricity Trading Platform in October, the total trading volume exceeded 20,000MWh in the first three months, and the transaction amount was more than NT$18 million. The potential for future business opportunities worths tens of billions of dollars.

The original target of Taiwan's energy policy is that renewable energy accounts for 20% in 2025. However, due to factors, such as economic growth, the return of Taiwanese enterprises and the expansion of semiconductor foundries, electricity consumption is expected to increase significantly, making renewable energy only account for 15.2% in 2025. To achieve the original target of 20% renewable energy, the domestic demand market needs to continue to grow. In line with the "New Southbound  Policy"  that  aims  to  link  with  local  industries  in  Southeast  Asian  countries,  the government has also esteblished the 'System Integration Promotion Alliance (SIPA) Project Office' to encourage private sectors to export Taiwan's solar energy system in order to promote downstrean integration of Taiwan's solar industry. However, due to the impact of COVID-19 on the global supply chain, more attention should be paid to the rising trend of installation costs caused by price fluctuation of raw materials and solar modules.

In the foreseeable future, the net-zero carbon emission path and domestic policy support will drive the renewable energy market. Taiwan should deepen its technological advantages, accelerate the transformation of the energy industry, strengthen the supply chain, and take a two-pronged approach to win international customers while driving the growth of the domestic market.

## (3) Electric Vehicle Industry

With the rapid development of battery and automobile technology, it is possible to replace gasoline with electricity as the main source of power for vehicles. Electric vehicles are vehicles that use batteries as energy storage and power supply and are driven by motors. Electric vehicles can be divided into BEVs (battery electric vehicles), HEVs (hybrid electric vehicles), PHEVs (plug-in hybrid electric vehicles) and REEVs (extended range electric vehicles) according to different power supply methods and ratio. In addition, there are other vehicles, such as fuel cell vehicles or solar cell vehicles, that can generate energy on their own.

From the Kyoto Protocol, the Paris Agreement, to the United Nations Climate Change Conference, led by European countries, countries around the world have begun to have constructive discussions and systematic measurement standards on environmental protection issues, especially on tracking and measuring greenhouse gas emissions, use of renewable energy, energy efficiency and climate

policy. The current global carbon emission target is 40% reduction from 2015 to 2025, among which the European vehicle target of 59 grams of carbon dioxide per kilometer in 2030 is the most stringent. Governments have also gradually issued timetables for banning the sale of fuel vehicles. For example, Norway and the Netherlands are expected to completely ban the sale of new fuel vehicles in 2025; and Germany will only approve license for zero-carbon vehicles after 2030, and have internal combustion engine (ICE) banned on the road after 2050. Japan has raised its 2030 carbon reduction target from 26% to 46%, and will ban the sale of fuel vehicles in 2035. In response to these carbon reduction policies, large car manufacturers have increased the proportion of electric vehicles in their product lines in order to meet the deadline and limits of carbon emissions in various countries. In order to achieve carbon reduction goals, countries have also provided various subsidy programs to electric vehicle manufacturers and customers to stimulate the growth of electric vehicle sales. According to the global electric vehicle sales data released by the Industrial Technology Research Institute in September 2021, statistics showed a record high increase of 85% in 2021 compared with 2020. Mainland China (32.5%), Japan (17.9%), the United States (16.3%), Germany (7.9%) and the United Kingdom (5%) were the top five countries based on the sales volume. The growth of electric vehicle sales will continue in 2022, but with the combined factors of increase in the base period, impact of COVID-19 and supply chain insufficiency, the annual growth rate is estimated to be 45% only. According to the Global EV Outlook released by the International Energy Agency (IEA), the number of electric vehicles, electric buses, electric lorries and electric trucks is expected to reach 145 million in 2030. The IEA believes that the number of electric vehicles in the world will continue to increase and is expected to reach 230 million in the next 10 years with vigorous promotion of international energy and climate goals by the governments around the world.

## 3. Trends of Products

Base on the demand for AIoT and 5G infrastructure equipment, Taiwan's SPS product development can be divided into two aspects: 1) the technology development is towards the field of high efficiency, multiple input voltage, wider operating temperature, intelligence. The equipment traditionally used in data centers, including servers, Networking and Telecom equipment for enterprises, and storage equipment, is also being applied to the communications room and base station environment. Modular design is adopted for products, parallel stacking mode (500W+500W+...) is applied, the application range of products is expanded (low-end, mid-end and high-end power), all of which has significantly shortened the product development cycle; 2) the product is developed as light, thin, short and small. The main market is the consumer end of cloud computing, such as smart mobile phones, notebook computers, tablet computers, etc., and small power suppliers applied in 3C products. Looking forward to the future, the market demand for small, light, energy-saving and low-cost products will continue to increase. With the adoption of smart and portable communication products in large numbers, the appearance of the products becomes smaller and thinner, with the advantages of being portable. Endusers  have  to  connect  with  the  cloud  through  the  network  and  service  providers  who  provide information with computing capacity, which directly stimulates the cloud service providers to build a large number of data centers. Under the convergence environment of 5G data and communication, both Telecom operators and network service providers must actively expand network equipment to meet the needs of users and AIoT equipment for information services, which will promote the growth of the market and form a virtuous cycle. Networking and Telecom equipment and consumer electronics products have become the most important market for SPS.

The global power supply for desktop personal computers has been well developed. In 2020, under the impact of the epidemic, the industry shows signs of accelerating decline and poor outlook of the market on the whole. The high level of standardization has forced desktop PC vendor manufacturers to expand their market share through price competition that drives down costs and mass production capacity. On the other hand, the market acceptance for beautiful and convenient All In One computer is increasing. Despite the recession, the market is still growing faster than traditional desktop PCs. In addition to basic applications, e-sports PC requires stable dynamic responses and high power output as a result of adopting high-efficiency GPU for lots of computing, and there will be room for growth in power supplies for such special applications.

Portable PCs, such as notebook computers, account for a large portion of current PC shipments. Under the influence of the epidemic, the market for laptop computers has grown rapidly due to the demand for remote offices and education. This type of power supply is designed in the form of a portable Adapter. With the M-type development of the market, the main growth markets are e-sports laptops above 150W and ultra-thin laptops with a low power consumption of 65W and 45W. High-end products below 65W tend to be gradually replaced by USB Type-C PD chargers due to the thin and light needs of the products. In terms of tablet computers and smart mobile phones, converters with lower power were mainly used in the past, or Charger was designed to adjust the output voltage to achieve a fastcharging function. The output power is developed to 65W or above, which can be applied to various consumer  electronic  products.  A  large  number  of  automation  processes  must  be  adopted  in manufacturing to reduce costs. Once the EU Act on Standardization of Mobile Phone Chargers is implemented, the mobile phone charger market is bound to be affected. In addition, the new Act on Efficiency Improvement Requirements for External Power Supply raised by the EU and the U.S. Department of Energy come into force in 2016, and higher conversion efficiency will also be a basic indicator. Last but not the least, in addition to the traditional single-voltage output products, the multifunctional power converters conforming to USB Power Delivery specifications can provide different voltage outputs, which can be applied in a variety of consumer electronic products. In 2020, mobile devices equipped with USB Type-C have become the mainstream products in the market. However, as the majority of users still own traditional USB Type-A or Micro USB devices, the market for small external power supplies/chargers with multiple USB charging ports continues to grow.

The technology of power supplies for personal computers extends upward to servers, large Networking, Telecom equipment and storage devices. With the rapid development of cloud computing, mid-end and low-end servers tend to be matured after years of rapid growth in recent years. Although the technology, complexity and stability of the power supply applied in servers are higher than those applied in PC power supply, as servers move towards a standardized single architecture, the power supply also moves towards standardization due to the high commercialization of the mid-end and low-end systems. As a

result, it is difficult for manufacturers to increase unit prices through differentiation. Therefore, in order to reduce the overall development cost, it tends to adopt the standardized design for power supply and reduce the number of parts and automatic production to improve the reliability.

In response to the large number of servers deployed in a single location by the data center, the product tends to gradually shift from continuous efficiency improvement of a single power supply to systematic optimization of smart power management and cabinet power architecture, enhance the power factor of power supply and reduce total harmonic distortion through the introduction of digital control. In recent years, with production and R&D bases of servers, large Networking and Telecom equipment and storage  equipment  moving  to  China  and  Taiwan,  Taiwan  power  supply  manufacturer  actively developing  their  design  capabilities  with  relatively  lower  price  pressure  compared  to  European, American  and  Japanese  manufacturers,  power  supplies  for  mid-end  and  low-end  servers,  large Networking  and  Telecom  equipments  and  storage  equipments  have  been  mainly  designed  and manufactured by Taiwan manufacturers. The server power supply market is becoming mature due to the advances in virtualization and cloud computing technology and the rise of distributed power architecture. The market for dedicated storage devices has also been hit by Intel-Based storage servers and cloud storage solutions. Under the decline of terminal application, the growth momentum of the market has shifted to Networking and Telecom  equipment as the focus. Base on the AIOT's edge computing requirements and as it is expected to adopt a large number of IT servers and Networking and Telecom equipment for 5G infrastructure, the IT system and power supply in line with the environmental  standards  of  telecommunications  equipment  and  computer  room  will  drive  the development of a new generation of products in the future.

Power supply for communication mostly adopts Distributed Power Architecture, which usually consists of an AC-DC Rectifier supplying the busbar voltage and a DC/DC Converter at the later stage. Such kinds of products are of high technology and with great importance attaching to product reliability. On the whole structure, it can reduce costs and improve efficiency by reducing the times of power conversion. The rectifier sector also develops toward high efficiency, high density. In consideration of costs of DC-DC converter at the later stage, traditional high-end isolated converters tend to be replaced by non-isolated converters (POLs) with lower cost. For bus bar voltage, with the rise of new energy sources and the application of data centers, more efficient HVDC systems sprung up in the market. The emergence of different architectures and applications is expected to create new growth momentum in the highly standardized telecommunications power supply market.

Given the rising awareness about environmental protection, the opposition of nuclear and the call for phasing out nuclear, the pursuit of zero carbon, the reduction use of fossils fuels and the increase of green energy contribute to the growing importance of electricity grid stability and the efficient use of energy.      Smart meters may enable power companies to keep track of trends in electricity consumption in a timely manner and dispatch limited power resources more efficiently. Replacing the traditional meters in every household with smart meters with communication function is the most basic and important step, which is also a necessary step.

Energy management services can inject new energy into all energy products. In addition to smart meters, if all kinds of grid-connected power generation devices, energy storage systems, renewable energy power plants or related products can be introduced through energy management system (EMS) and demand control technology, the sales value of products in the power supply market can be doubled.

With the popularity of cloud computing and big data applications, data centers are becoming largescale, which also leads to a significant increase in the purchase of relevant power systems. OCP (Open Compute Project, initiated by Facebook, etc.), ODCC (Open Data Center Committee, initiated by BAT), Open19 (Open Data Center, initiated by LinkedIn) and other open computing organizations are playing a major role in driving innovation in the data center field, all of which have come up with a reference specification for modular cabinet design. In consideration of standardized cabinet design is a trend in the design of power converters applied for data centers, the design of modular converter module and expandable  cabinet  is  proposed,  which  will  enable  the  related  products  to  meet  the  functional requirements of major data center manufacturers.

About the EV industry, the supply chain has undergone tremendous changes after Tesla launched platform-based and modular production. Take the electric vehicle electronic control field covered by the company as an example, it has gradually moved from individual components (such as on-board chargers, motor controllers, DC converters) to an integrated design (all-in-one electronic control products). The integrated design enables the design of the mechanism and the appearance to be shared to achieve a

miniaturized design and increase the power density. To improve the mileage and charging speed of electric vehicles, battery modules and electronic control systems continue to evolve towards 800V high voltage. The 800V high voltage platform launched by Porsche is marking the start of high voltage era. For the batteries in electric vehicles, mainstream electric vehicles manufacturers around the world use high energy density lithium batteries as an important driving force for expanding the territory of electric vehicles. However, even though the prospects of lithium batteries are promising, the market still hopes to develop new batteries that have higher energy density and higher safety that lithium batteries because numerous charge and discharge can easily affect the lifespan of lithium batteries and there are concerns for inflammation. Among them, the development of solid-state batteries and fuel cells has received the most attention. The development of electronic vehicle motors is also moving towards integration. Motor, transmissions and motor controllers are integrated and combined with artificial intelligence and big data for control.

According to the analysis, the main customers of in-vehicle products of electric vehicles are from America and Japan, and their models are primarily sold in American and Asia. The principal competitor in Taiwan is Delta Electronics. Facing the huge business opportunities in the electric vehicle market, we are in a very favorable position. With the launch of all-in-one integrated products, the application of next-generation compound semiconductors and the continuous accumulation of R&D technologies, the automotive products are expected to have a long-term growth. However, attention should be paid to the shortage of components and long delivery time of semiconductors.

## 4. Competition

Taiwan is a major producer of information products in the world. Driven by downstream industries, Taiwan ranks first in global shipments of power supplies. In recent years, due to the impact of the PC industry being hit by the rise of low-cost computers, tablets and smartphones, the competition from Chinese manufacturers at low prices, and the global economic downturn for several years, the prices of power supply products have been declining year by year, and the manufacturers' gross margins are not good as they used to be. However, with the increasing demand for energy-saving and carbon reduction in various countries, the conversion efficiency of power supply and power management function has become  the  focus  of  customer  requirements.  In  recent  years,  the  concept  of  smart  electricity consumption has attracted more attention from all countries. Energy saving and effective use of energy has become one of the key requirements of competing products from all countries. Smart meters are the first step to implement smart power grids. How to effectively capture the data that users need from meters has become an important issue. In addition, the application of data captured by meters is also of great importance, and many enterprises have begun to invest resources in research and development in this market. Under the development of industry standards and the successive formulation of product specifications, various lighting major manufacturers have launched a complete series of products. The threshold of R&D design, manufacturing capability and cost control has also been raised.

Furthermore, large cloud service companies and data center operators, and new types of applications such as edge computing systems for 5G infrastructure, define hardware through software and introduce the concept of open hardware standards, which will not only continue to change the traditional data center  equipment,  but  will  also  impact  the  supply  pattern  and  demand  of  telecommunications equipment. They, together with Telecom providers and data centers, purchased a huge amount of servers, Networking and Telecom equipment and storage, and went beyond the traditional brand vendors and directly to Asia to seek customized products from ODM manufacturers according to specific requirements, which caused a certain impact on the supply chain of traditional commercial information equipment. As a key component of the power supply industry, it is necessary to readjust the product strategy and design production mode in the new supply chain pattern, and seize the opportunity to seek a new position.

Besides, due to China's manpower shortage and the risk of the US-China trade war, in order to maintain lower manufacturing costs and improve price competitiveness, and quickly launch energy-saving products that meet the market demand, and reduce the risk of single manufacturing site, domestic SPS manufacturers have also set up factories in Thailand, Malaysia, India, the Philippines and other places, shortened the development cycle through internal design standardization, and improved the automation productivity of mid-end and low-end products. In the past few years, the global power supply industry has been moving towards integration through consolidation and the elimination of a number of small factories in the face of fierce market competition. However, there is still no single player to dominate

the market, with the big Taiwanese players competing against each other. The conditions of each competitor are different, so the medium and above-sized companies in the market still have their own room for growth and development due to the difference in product positioning, and the advantages in manufacturing and R&D capabilities.

## 3. Demand and Supply Conditions for the Market in the Future, and the Market's Growth Potential

All industries were affected by COVID-19 variants in 2021 and the impact continues into 2022. The service industry, tourism and the manufacturing industry are the worst hit. However, there is no sense of panic with countries and industries taking countermeasures with caution. According to the latest report by the research firm IDC, the global personal computer (PC) shipment increased by 15% from 2021, driven by home working and long-distance teaching. The outlook for industrial electronics products continues to be positive due to the demand for cloud, 5G, servers, storage devices and networking and telecom products.

In recent years, with the rising awareness of environmental protection and the continuous promotion of energy conservation and carbon reduction by the government, smart grids, fuel cells, electric vehicle onboard electronics, peripheral charging related facilities and medical care equipment, etc. are the longterm growth drivers of the power supply industry. In particular, AcBel has been deeply engaged in smart meters for a long time. In the future, there will be about one million standard biddings released in Taiwan. In addition, demand for alternative energy, supported by public expectations for cleaner energy and government policies, has soared, creating a new market. AcBel has a clear plan to build a solar power station, and hopes to gradually reach an economic scale and create synergy together with the power industry.

The Company has profound power R&D technology, and has the inherent advantage of diversified product lines, which, coupled with the variety of electronic products in the market, the rise of public awareness of environmental protection, the external factors of the government for energy policy support, are the best niche for sustainable operation of the Company. The Company will, based on the power supply manufacturing, aiming at innovative electricity service, gradually transform from power supply product manufacturing into power supply service company, including power generation, power transfer, electricity consumption, storage and other innovative electricity converging services, and strive to provide system solutions and a full range of power services.

## 3. Retirement System and Its Implementation

The Company has established a Retirement Measures for Employees covering all formal staff. In accordance with the provisions of the Labor Standards Act, the Company shall set aside 3.5% of the total payroll on a monthly basis as the labor retirement reserve, which shall be deposited in the Bank of Taiwan (former Central Trust Of China). When the actual pension is paid, it shall be paid from the special account of the retirement reserve. If there is any shortage, it shall be paid by the Company. In addition, since July 1, 2005, the Company has, in line with the implementation of the Labor Pension Act (hereinafter referred to as the "new system"), allocated the labor retirement reserve for employees who are eligible for the new system, according to their allocation rate of 6% of their monthly wages to the individual labor pension accounts at the Bureau of Labor Insurance, and the allocation amount will be recognized as current expenses. Subsidiaries allocate pension funds or provide retirement benefits according to local laws and regulations to protect the rights and interests of their colleagues.

## 2. Changes in Interest Rates

COVID-19 continued to plague the world in 2021, caused millions of deaths and devastated the global economy. The heavily hit U.S. and Europe maintained low interest rates and quantitative easing. However, given the increasing inflation and high vaccination coverage, the market generally expects the central banks in the U.S. and Taiwan will raise interest rates in 2022 to tackle inflation. The Company and its subsidiaries currently have a large amount of available bank credits. Even if the interest rates are adjusted upward, the impact on the Company's capital utilization should be limited.

## 3. Changes in Exchange Rate

The exchange rate of Taiwan dollar against the US dollar at the end of 2021 was 27.69 dollars, an appreciation of 0.818 dollars (+2.87%) compared with that at the end of 2020, which was unfavorable to most of the products quoted in US dollars by the Company and its subsidiaries. In order to effectively manage the exchange rate risk, the Company and its subsidiaries try their best to quote in US dollars for purchase and payment, so as to achieve the effect of natural hedging. The Company  also has formulated the Operational procedures for Acquisition and Disposal of Assets, with the financial department referring to the analysis of well-known banks and research institutions at home and abroad, to  engage  in  forwarding  exchange,  exchange  rate  swaps  and  other  hedging  derivative  financial commodity trading, so as to reduce the risk of exchange rate fluctuations.

## 4. Inflation

The consumer price index (CPI) and the wholesale price index (WPI) in Taiwan increased by 1.96% and 9.4%, respectively, in 2021 from 2020. The Company and its subsidiaries raised selling prices accordingly and hence the profits and losses were not materially affected.
